A morning coffee is now almost a luxury for Europeans.
That's according to the Eurostat statistics office.
It's compiled data on the cost of a pick-me-up in the EU.
Coffee prices were up almost 17% in August from last year.
If you don't take it black, the cost of a cup gets even worse.
Fresh whole milk prices jumped by almost a quarter,...
...and sugar was up even more by over a third.
The data showed prices for the staples rose in every EU country bar Malta.
Finns faced the biggest jump for coffee,...
In Poland, the price of sugar more than doubled.
...hit a new record high of 10% in September.
Rising food and energy prices were the big driver.
